intro: Rigiolepis leptantha f. leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved lichen, is a member of the Parmeliaceae family. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus structure that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provide the photosynthetic capability necessary for survival. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on bark or rocks in temperate regions. Its slow growth and specialized habitat make it a valuable indicator of environmental health.
